title: Roe Valley Country Park Walking Route

images.title: Kenneth  Allen / Roe Valley Country Park, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Roe Valley Country Park. It is located to the south of Limavady

images.title: P Flannagan / The River Roe as it flows through the Roe Valley Country Park, Limavady., via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The River Roe as it flows through the Roe Valley Country Park, Limavady. The River Roe, especially after rainfall, can be seen surging its way through the Park.

images.title: Kenneth  Allen / Roe Valley Country Park plaque, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Roe Valley Country Park information board. Pictured at Carrick Mills car park, note the calling card at the top right hand side.

images.title: P Flannagan / Weir in the Roe Valley Country Park, Limavady., via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Rushing weir in the park, Limavady. The Roe Valley Country Park runs for three miles either side of the River Roe near Limavady. It contains a countryside Museum and the Dogleap Centre where the story of the valley is told.

description: Enjoy a waterside walk along the River Roe in this country park near Limavady. You can start your walk from the visitor centre next to the ornamental lake. The footpaths then follow the River Roe which meanders pleasantly through the park. Along the way there are pretty waterfalls, spectacular gorges and attractive woodland. In the warmer months the park is covered with pretty wildlflowers. You can learn about the area's interesting industrial heritage in the museum and visit the remains of industrial buildings and the restored water wheel. National Cycle Network Route 93 runs past the park so you could pick it up from Limavady and head south to visit by bike.
